results.title: Aesthetic Outcome of Propranolol vs Atenolol Treatment of Children with Infantile Haemangioma
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_271245 @DISEASE_OMIM:271245 @@@Infantile haemangiomas@@@ are common @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@benign tumours@@@ of infancy, which can be treated effectively with beta-blockers such as @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Hermans MM, Breugem CC, Schappin R, Jonge Poerink E, Mendels EJ, Ragamin A, Breur JMPJ, Langeveld HR, Raphael MF, De Laat PCJ, De Wildt SN, Rietman AB, Pasmans SGMA, De Graaf M. Aesthetic Outcome of Propranolol vs Atenolol Treatment of Children with Infantile Haemangioma Acta Derm Venereol. 2022 Oct 11;102():adv00788. PMID: 35506358

results.title: Use of beta-blocker types and risk of incident prostate cancer in a multiethnic population.
results.text_hl: Of beta-blocker types, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ alone was associated with a 38% reduction in odds of incident @DISEASE_Cap_Myopathy @DISEASE_MESH:C579969 @@@CaP@@@ (P= 0.01), with a 40% and 54% reduction in risks of National Comprehensive @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@Cancer@@@ Network intermediate and high-risk @DISEASE_Cap_Myopathy @DISEASE_MESH:C579969 @@@CaP@@@ (P = 0.03 and P = 0.03, respectively) compared to @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ not taking a beta-blocker.

citations.NLM: Zahalka AH, Fram E, Lin W, Mohn L, Frenette PS, Agalliu I, Watts KL. Use of beta-blocker types and risk of incident prostate cancer in a multiethnic population. Urol Oncol. 2020 Oct;38(10):794.e11-794.e16. PMID: 32307329
citations.BibTeX: @article{32307329, title={Use of beta-blocker types and risk of incident prostate cancer in a multiethnic population.}, author={Zahalka AH and Fram E and Lin W and Mohn L and Frenette PS and Agalliu I and Watts KL}, journal={Urol Oncol}, volume={38}, number={10}, pages={794.e11-794.e16}}

results.title: beta2-and beta3-Adrenergic Receptors Contribute to Cancer-Evoked Pain in a Mouse Model of Osteosarcoma via Modulation of Neural Macrophages
results.text_hl: Conversely, the treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ induced a slight, but not significant, reduction in the @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ size, denoting a minor role of the @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_11554 @@@beta1-AR@@@ subtype in controlling @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ growth (Figure 2A).

citations.NLM: Bruno G, De Logu F, Souza Monteiro de Araujo D, Subbiani A, Lunardi F, Rettori S, Nassini R, Favre C, Calvani M. beta2-and beta3-Adrenergic Receptors Contribute to Cancer-Evoked Pain in a Mouse Model of Osteosarcoma via Modulation of Neural Macrophages Front Pharmacol. 2021;12():697912. PMID: 34646131

results.title: NITROSAMINE CONTAMINATION WITHIN CARDIAC MULTIMEDICATION - SARTANS (VALSARTAN), CALCIUM CHANNEL BLOCKERS (AMLODIPINE AND NIFEDIPINE), AND ANTIARRHYTHMICS (PROPAFENONE) AS A SIGNIFICANT FACTOR IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND PROGRESSION OF MULTIPLE KERATINOCYTIC CANCERS: ADVANCEMENT ROTATION FLAP FOR KERATOACANTHOMA OF THE UPPER LIP AND UNDERMINING SURGERY FOR BCC OF THE SHOULDER AS AN OPTIMAL DERMATOSURGICAL APPROACH.
results.text_hl: We report another patient who simultaneously developed 2 @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cutaneous tumors@@@ under potentially/actually @CHEMICAL_Nitrosamines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009602 @@@nitrosamine@@@ contaminated drugs such as: beta blockers- @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, calcium antagonists- @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@/@CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, sartans- valsartan and antiarrhythmics- @CHEMICAL_Propafenone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011405 @@@propafenone@@@.

results.title: beta-Adrenoreceptor antagonists reduce cancer cell proliferation, invasion, and migration.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: We investigated the efficacy of @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI118,551@@@ on proliferation, migration, and invasion of non-stimulated @DISEASE_Hereditary_Breast_and_Ovarian_Cancer_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D061325 @@@breast@@@ (@CELLLINE_CVCL:0031 @@@MCF7@@@), @DISEASE_Colonic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003108 @@@colon@@@ (@CELLLINE_CVCL:0320 @@@HT-29@@@), and hepatocellular (@CELLLINE_CVCL:0027 @@@HepG2@@@) @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ cells.

citations.NLM: Işeri OD, Sahin FI, Terzi YK, Yurtcu E, Erdem SR, Sarialioglu F. beta-Adrenoreceptor antagonists reduce cancer cell proliferation, invasion, and migration. Pharm Biol. 2014 Nov;52(11):1374-81. PMID: 25026350

results.title: [Antihypertensive drugs and malignant neoplasia].
results.text_hl: Association between the use of @CHEMICAL_Reserpine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012110 @@@reserpine@@@ and @DISEASE_Breast_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D001943 @@@breast cancer@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, between @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and some types of @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ in elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ also can not be ruled out.

citations.NLM: Preobrazhenskiĭ DV, Sidorenko BA, Stetsenko TM, Kiktev VG. [Antihypertensive drugs and malignant neoplasia]. Kardiologiia. 2002;42(5):62-7. PMID: 12494152

results.title: Antihypertensive therapy and the risk of malignancies.
results.text_hl: The association between @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ death was analysed pooling three randomized controlled studies, including 1879 treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ and 3078 non-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, yielding a pooled OR of 1.36 (95% CI, 1.02-1.82); however, data from non-randomized studies did not confirm the latter.

citations.NLM: Grossman E, Messerli FH, Goldbourt U. Antihypertensive therapy and the risk of malignancies. Eur Heart J. 2001 Aug;22(15):1343-52. PMID: 11465967

results.title: Evaluation of the tumor-promoting activity of two beta-adrenoreceptor blocking agents, propranolol and atenolol, in liver of Fischer 344 rats.
results.text_hl: Evaluation of the @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@-promoting activity of two beta-adrenoreceptor blocking agents, @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, in liver of @CELLLINE_CVCL:V767 @@@Fischer 344@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Aspirin and atenolol enhance metformin activity against breast cancer by targeting both neoplastic and microenvironment cells
results.text_hl: Both @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@Aspirin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@, when added to @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, significantly reduced the endothelial cell component of @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ vessels, whereas pericytes were reduced by the addition of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ but not by the addition of @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@Aspirin@@@.

citations.NLM: Talarico G, Orecchioni S, Dallaglio K, Reggiani F, Mancuso P, Calleri A, Gregato G, Labanca V, Rossi T, Noonan DM, Albini A, Bertolini F. Aspirin and atenolol enhance metformin activity against breast cancer by targeting both neoplastic and microenvironment cells Sci Rep. 2016 Jan 5;6():18673. PMID: 26728433

results.title: Carcinogenicity of cardiovascular drugs.
results.text_hl: Several prospective studies showed that treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ may increase mortality from @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@malignancy@@@.
